summary: REQ-1 and REQ-3 appear implemented by introducing a dedicated contact-form WhatsApp number in centralized config and using it to generate a post-submission wa.me link with prefilled submitted fields. REQ-2 cannot be fully verified from the provided diff summary because global/header/footer WhatsApp links are not shown as updated or preserved, only described in a summaries file.

missing_requirements.requirement: Keep the website’s general WhatsApp integration pointing to +919182768591 for standard “Chat on WhatsApp” buttons/links (header/footer/contact info), while still allowing the contact-form-details WhatsApp CTA to target +919181768591.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows ContactPage using the dedicated contact-form WhatsApp number, but does not show evidence of updating/preserving the general WhatsApp links in header/footer/other components. The only mention that other links use the general number is in a modified summary document, not in the actual component code changes shown.

hallucinated_features.description: Changed/introduced various site configuration fields unrelated to the WhatsApp-number split (e.g., branding text, contact email formatting, contact phone display/tel fields).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest only asks to centralize two WhatsApp numbers and adjust which number is used for the contact-form success CTA vs general chat links; it does not request changing site name/tagline/description or altering contact email/phone fields.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/updated project tracking metadata (new_feature_requests AR-1..AR-4) in project_state.json.
hallucinated_features.reason: No requirement asks for modifying project_state.json or adding internal tracking entries; this is outside the requested frontend behavior/config change.
